Change the Record by Paul Cocksedge

In this interview filmed at Dezeen Space, London designer Paul Cocksedge explains the ideas behind Change the Record, a project where vinyl records are moulded into amplifiers for smartphones.

See more of Dezeen’s architecture and design movies here: http://www.dezeen.com/tag/dezeen-movies/

Change the Record by Paul Cocksedge

music

unconsumption the best way to combine two of




unconsumption:

The best way to combine two of your biggest passions into one? Ask 22-year-old industrial design student Nick Pourfard, who recently launched his Prisma Guitars brand.

Pourfard, who’s also a proficient, self-taught woodworker, takes used and battered skate decks and upcycles them into eye-catching, multicolored electric guitars, thus melding his love for both skateboarding and music.

(via Designer Nick Pourfard Upcycles Skate Decks Into Colorful Guitars | HYPEBEAST)

— d.n.

unconsumption the best way to combine two of

music design


Sound fighter est un dispositif totalement inédit créé par DDB Paris pour la Maison de la Radio. Pour la première fois, le légendaire jeu Street Fighter n'est pas joué avec des manettes mais plutôt avec deux pianos.

Created by DDB Paris for the « Maison de la Radio », Sound Fighter is a new way to play to Street Fighter. For the first time in the world, you don’t need controllers but two pianos.

Wow

typography music


typostrate:

Video Wednesday 59

Left handed lettering seems to be quite impossible. That it’s not, is showing us Matt Vergotis, designer, founder of verg and lettering lover from Cold Coast, Australia. His philosophy is simple but deep: “Do what you love.” He is one burning graphic designer with the attitude that the client must love what he gets from him. If he doesn’t the job is not done good. What do you think?
